item.title: Git in Golang
item.description: Nice excercise Recently I stumbled upon codecrafters, a wonderful resource for learning programming. So I decided to try their course called ‘Build your own Git’.

item.title: Build Toolchain and Scripting
item.description: Systems organization and tooling Recently I am reorganizing my DSA folder, where I keep my primitive data structures and algorithms implementations in C.

item.title: B-Tree Data Structure
item.description: Pseudocode is better than natural language As you could notice in the previous post, I am learning about how to build some stuff.

item.title: Blockchain in Golang
item.description: Reflection on complexity Despite of how much time already passed since I started to learn how to code, it certainly doesn’t feels like I am steadily improving that much.
